title: Stuck at "Adding a new content group..."
content:
Smart Analytics gets stuck at "Adding a new content group..." after you click Add New Content Group.

Cause

This issue occurs due to a DIH connection error.

  1. Log in to a control plane node as root or a sudo user, and run the following command to get the pod name of smarta-installer: kubectl get pods -n <namespace> | grep installer
  2. Run the following command to access the installer's log: kubectl logs <installer pod name> -n <namespace> -c suite-config
  3. You can find the following text in the log.
    Connection refused: smarta-saw-dih-svc.

Solution

  1. Log in to a control plane node as root or a sudo user, and run the following command to get the pod name of smarta-installer: kubectl get pods -n <namespace> | grep installer
  2. Run the following command to restart the installer pod: kubectl delete pod <installer pod name> -n <namespace>
  3. Log in to a control plane node as root or a sudo user, and check if smarta-saw-dih is running and ready.
  4. Run the following command to view the dih pod status:
    kubectl get pods -n <namespace> -o wide | grep saw-dih
    Note the IP of the pod.
  5. Run the following command to redistribute:
    curl "https://<pod IP>:1444/DREREDISTRIBUTE?NoArchive=True&BatchSize=500&Compress=false&Delete=true&KillDuplicates=true"
    Note the Index ID.
  6. Log in to Suite Administration, click Configurations, in Smart Analytics tab, click Go to Smart Analytics. In Smart Analytics Assistant, double-click XService DIH, enter the following action and click RUN to check the job status.
    https://smarta-saw-dih-svc:1443/action=indexergetstatus&index=<IndexID>
